RUN-ON LINE: The opposite of an end-stopped line,

SLABS:
STANZA: A division of a poem into sections according to a defined pattern. There
are several common stanza forms—usually determined by the length of the
poetic line, the meter, and the rhyme scheme.
STRESS: Ohe force and loudness vith vhich a word or syllable is spoken.
VERSE: used in two ways: (l) a name given to metrical writing in general (2) a
unit of poetry—most cacaaonly a line or stanza.
